history.content:
I declared the double major (same requirements as transfer) and although I didn't have this problem the requirement is in fact to have >3.3 GPA for overall, technical, and EECS-specific. So you can wait a semester, take some EECS courses and get your GPA above 3.3 so that you can do the transfer,

I haven't really heard of much leniency on this front wrt transferring with lower than 3.3 GPA.

Are applications for request of major switch to eecs (coming from bioe) automatically rejected based on gpa, or are other factors such as course load taken into account? My technical gpa is above 3.3, but the EECS specific gpa is slightly below the cap; is there any chance at all or is it better to wait? Has anyone had any experience with this?
history.subject: Major Switch Requirements
